content:
I'm so glad you think so! Creating a shared document or spreadsheet can be a powerful tool to bring classmates together and make the reunion a more meaningful experience. By collecting information and updates from classmates, you'll be able to:

* Create a sense of community and connection among classmates
* Encourage participation and engagement in the reunion planning process
* Gather valuable information and stories to share during the reunion
* Provide a keepsake or memento for classmates to treasure after the reunion

Remember to keep the document or spreadsheet organized, easy to use, and accessible to all classmates. You can also consider setting up a deadline for classmates to submit their information to ensure you have enough time to review and prepare for the reunion.

Additionally, you could also consider creating a private online forum or discussion board where classmates can share their thoughts, memories, and updates in a more conversational format. This can be a great way to foster discussions, share memories, and build excitement for the reunion.

Overall, by creating a shared document or spreadsheet, you'll be able to collect valuable information, encourage participation, and build a sense of community among classmates. It's a wonderful way to make the reunion a truly special and unforgettable experience!
